1{-# LANGUAGE PatternSynonyms #-}
2{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
3
4-- | Text decomposition by subtext.
5--
6-- = Subtext
7--
8--   Subtext is a domain-specific language for text decomposition.
9--   The @subtext@ relmap operator provides the functionality of this language.
10--   In the following descrition, we use a symbol
11--   /E/ for subtext expression,
12--   //P/ for present term name,
13--   //N/ for new term name,
14--   /N/ for symbolic name,
15--   /T/ for text,
16--   /C/ for character (single-letter text).
17--
18-- == Relmap operator
19--
20--   The @subtext@ operator decompose text using subtext expression.
21--   There are two ways for describing expression: single or bundle.
22--
23--   [ subtext /P ( E ) ]
24--     Decompose text content of /\/P/ by single expression /E/.
25--   [ subtext /P { N1 = E1 | N2 = E2 | ... } ]
26--     Decompose text by bundle of named expressions.
27--     Text decomposition starts from /N1/.
28--
29-- == Basic patterns
30--
31--   [ ? ]
32--     Any character.
33--   [ ?? ]
34--     Context-dependent pattern.
35--   [ begin ]
36--     Beginning of text.
37--   [ end ]
38--     End of text.
39--
40-- == Texts
41--
42--   [ T ]
43--     Text literal as /T/.
44--   [ char T ]
45--     Alternative occurences of characters included in /T/.
46--   [ word T ]
47--     Alternative occurences of words included in /T/.
48--   [ C1 to C2 ]
49--     Character betweeen C1 and C2.
50--
51--   [ space ]
52--     Unicode space character or space-like control character
53--     including tabs (HT\/VT), newlines (CR\/LF), or form feed (FF).
54--     See 'Data.Char.isSpace'.
55--   [ digit ]
56--     ASCII digit.
57--     See 'Data.Char.isDigit'.
58--   [ letter ]
59--     Unicode letter character.
60--     See 'Data.Char.isLetter'.
61--
62--   [ SP ]
63--     One-or-more spaces.
64--   [ 012 ]
65--     One-or-more digits.
66--   [ ABC ]
67--     One-or-more letters.
68--
69-- == Combinations
70--
71--   [ E1 | E2 ]
72--     Alternative occurence of /E1/ or /E2/.
73--   [ E1 ++ E2 ]
74--     Sequence of /E1/ followed by /E2/.
75--   [ E1 or E2 ]
76--     Alternative occurence of /E1/ or /E2/.
77--   [ E1 and E2 ]
78--     /E1/ and additional condition /E2/.
79--   [ not E ]
80--     Inverted condition.
81--   [ last E ]
82--     Find last /E/.
83--   [ ( E ) ]
84--     Group expression /E/.
85--   [ &#x5B; E &#x5D; ]
86--     Zero-or-one occurences of /E/. (Option)
87--   [ { E } ]
88--     Zero-or-more occurences of /E/. (Zero-repeat)
89--   [ {- E -} ]
90--     One-or-more occurences of /E/. (One-repeat)
91--   [ E1 sep E2 ]
92--     /E1/-separated /E2/. (Zero-repeat)
93--
94-- == Gathering subtext
95--
96--   [ /N E ]
97--     Submatch for /E/ whose name is /\/N/.
98--   [ /N ]
99--     Named submatch, equivalent to /\/N/ ??.
100--   [ off E ]
101--     Turn off gathering text in /E/.
102--   [ on E ]
103--     Turn on gathering text in /E/.
104
105module Koshucode.Baala.Rop.Flat.Subtext
106  ( SubtextPara, consSubtext, relmapSubtext, relkitSubtext,
107  ) where
108
109import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base               as B
110import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax             as S
111import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Data               as D
112import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Core               as C
113import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Rop.Base           as Op
114import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Subtext            as T
115import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Subtext.Expr       as T
116import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Subtext.Para       as T
117import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Rop.Flat.Message   as Msg
118
119
120-- --------------------------------------------  Operator
121
122type SubtextPara = (S.TermName, [T.NameDepth], T.CharMatch, Bool)
123
124consSubtext :: (D.CContent c) => C.RopCons c
125consSubtext med =
126  do term  <- Op.getTerm   med "-term"
127     sub   <- Op.getTrees  med "-subtext"
128     trim  <- Op.getSwitch med "-trim"
129     b     <- parseBundle sub
130     let ns    = T.bundleSubmatch b
131         match = T.matchBundle b
132     Right $ relmapSubtext med (term, ns, match, trim)
133
134relmapSubtext :: (D.CContent c) => C.Intmed c -> SubtextPara -> C.Relmap c
135relmapSubtext med = C.relmapFlow med . relkitSubtext
136
137relkitSubtext :: (D.CContent c) => SubtextPara -> Maybe D.Head -> B.Ab (C.Relkit c)
138relkitSubtext _ Nothing = Right C.relkitNothing
139relkitSubtext (n, ns, match, trim) (Just he1) = Right kit2 where
140    pick    = Op.picker he1 [n]
141    he2     = D.headAppend (fst <$> ns) he1
142    kit2    = C.relkitJust he2 $ C.RelkitOneToOne False f2
143    result  = subtextResult trim ns
144    f2 cs   = case pick cs of
145               [c] | D.isText c
146                   -> case match $ D.gText c of
147                        Just (_, rs) -> result rs ++ cs
148                        Nothing      -> result [] ++ cs
149               _ -> result [] ++ cs
150
151subtextResult :: (D.CEmpty c, D.CText c, D.CList c) =>
152    Bool -> [T.NameDepth] -> [(S.TermName, String)] -> [c]
153subtextResult trim ns rs = result <$> ns where
154    text = D.pText . trimIf trim
155    result (n, depth) =
156        case lookup' n rs of
157          ts | depth > 0  -> D.pList (text <$> ts)
158          t : _           -> text t
159          []              -> D.empty
160
161lookup' :: (Eq a) => a -> [(a, b)] -> [b]
162lookup' n ass = snd <$> filter eq ass where
163    eq (n', _) = n == n'
164
165trimIf :: Bool -> String -> String
166trimIf True  t = B.trimBoth t
167trimIf False t = t
168
169
170-- --------------------------------------------  Parser
171
172-- | Type for subtext expression.
173type CharExpr = T.Expr Char
174
175-- | Type for subtext bundle.
176type CharBundle = T.Bundle Char
177
178pattern L tok   <- B.TreeL tok
179pattern B g xs  <- B.TreeB g _ xs
180pattern Key  n  <- S.TTextRaw _ n
181pattern Text t  <- S.TTextQQ  _ t
182pattern Char c  <- S.TTextQQ  _ [c]
183pattern Term n  <- S.TTermN _ _ n
184
185unknownSyntax :: (Show a) => a -> B.Ab b
186unknownSyntax x = Msg.adlib $ "subtext syntax error " ++ show x
187
188unknownBracket :: (Show a) => a -> B.Ab b
189unknownBracket g = Msg.adlib $ "subtext unknown bracket " ++ show g
190
191unknownKeyword :: String -> B.Ab b
192unknownKeyword n = Msg.adlib $ "subtext unknown keyword " ++ n
193
194divide :: String -> S.TTreesTo [[S.TTree]]
195divide s = S.divideTreesBy (== s)
196
197-- | Parse token trees into subtext bundle.
198parseBundle :: [S.TTree] -> B.Ab CharBundle
199parseBundle = bundle where
200    bundle xs@[B S.BracketSet sub] =
201        case step1 `mapM` divide "|" sub of
202          Left _    -> single xs
203          Right nxs -> do let ns = fst <$> nxs
204                          es <- step2 ns `mapM` nxs
205                          Right $ T.bundle es
206    bundle xs = single xs
207
208    single xs = do e <- parseSubtext [] xs
209                   Right $ T.bundle [("start", e)]
210
211    step1 :: [S.TTree] -> B.Ab (String, [S.TTree])
212    step1 xs = case divide "=" xs of
213                 [[L (Key n)], x] -> Right (n, x)
214                 _                -> unknownSyntax xs
215
216    step2 :: [String] -> (String, [S.TTree]) -> B.Ab (String, CharExpr)
217    step2 ns (n, x) = do e <- parseSubtext ns x
218                         Right (n, e)
219
220-- | Parse token trees into subtext expression.
221parseSubtext :: [String] -> [S.TTree] -> B.Ab CharExpr
222parseSubtext ns = trees False where
223
224    -- Trees
225    trees :: Bool -> [S.TTree] -> B.Ab CharExpr
226    trees _ [L (Key n), x]   = keyOp n x
227    trees _ [L (Term n), x]  = Right . T.sub n =<< tree x  -- /N E
228    trees _ [L (Term n)]     = Right $ T.sub n T.what      -- /N
229    trees _ []               = Right T.succ                -- ()
230    trees _ [x]              = tree x
231    trees False xs           = opTop xs
232    trees True  xs           = unknownSyntax $ show xs
233
234    -- Leaf or branch
235    tree :: S.TTree -> B.Ab CharExpr
236    tree (L x)        = leaf x
237    tree (B g xs)     = branch g xs
238    tree x            = unknownSyntax x
239
240    leaf :: S.Token -> B.Ab CharExpr
241    leaf (Text t)     = Right $ T.equal t     -- "LITERAL"
242    leaf (Key n)      = key n
243    leaf x            = unknownSyntax x
244
245    branch :: S.BracketType -> [S.TTree] -> B.Ab CharExpr
246    branch S.BracketGroup xs  = opTop xs            -- ( E )
247    branch S.BracketSet   xs  = bracket T.many  xs  -- { E }
248    branch S.BracketTie   xs  = bracket T.many1 xs  -- {- E -}
249    branch S.BracketList  xs  = bracket T.maybe xs  -- [ E ]
250    branch br             _   = unknownBracket br
251
252    bracket op xs = do e <- trees False xs
253                       Right $ op e
254
255    -- Prefix operators
256    keyOp "char" (L (Text s))  = Right $ T.char s             -- char E
257    keyOp "word" (L (Text s))  = Right $ T.word s             -- word E
258    keyOp "not"  x             = Right . T.not    =<< tree x  -- not E
259    keyOp "last" x             = Right . T.last   =<< tree x  -- last E
260    keyOp "on"   x             = Right . T.gather =<< tree x  -- on E
261    keyOp "off"  x             = Right . T.skip   =<< tree x  -- off E
262    keyOp n _                  = unknownSyntax n
263
264    key n | n `elem` ns  = Right $ T.change n
265    key "?"              = Right T.any
266    key "??"             = Right T.what
267    key "begin"          = Right T.begin
268    key "end"            = Right T.end
269    key "space"          = Right T.space
270    key "digit"          = Right T.digit
271    key "letter"         = Right T.letter
272    key "SP"             = many1 T.space
273    key "012"            = many1 T.digit
274    key "ABC"            = many1 T.letter
275    key n                = unknownKeyword n
276
277    many1 = Right . T.many1
278
279    -- Infix operators
280    opTop   = opAlt
281    opAlt   = inf "|"   T.or    opSeq   -- E | E | E
282    opSeq   = inf "++"  T.seq   opOr    -- E ++ E ++ E
283    opOr    = inf "or"  T.or    opAnd   -- E or E or E
284    opAnd   = inf "and" T.and   opSep   -- E and E and E
285
286    inf op f g xs = Right . f =<< mapM g (divide op xs)
287
288    opSep xs = case divide "sep" xs of  -- E sep E
289                 [sep, v] -> do ev   <- trees False v
290                                esep <- trees False sep
291                                Right $ T.sep esep ev
292                 [xs2]    -> opTo xs2
293                 _        -> unknownSyntax xs
294
295    opTo xs = case divide "to" xs of    -- E to E
296                 [[L (Char from)], [L (Char to)]]
297                        -> Right $ T.to from to
298                 [xs2]  -> trees True xs2  -- Turn on loop check
299                 _      -> unknownSyntax xs
300
